business.headline: Why Adani Ports decided to opt out of $553 million US loan for Sri Lanka projectAdani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) said it would instead use its own resources to fund the project, citing alignment with its capital management plans.
Elon Musk's Tesla resumes hunt for New Delhi showroom with DLF: ReportTesla has resumed showroom space searches in New Delhi, exploring options with DLF, as it reconsiders entering India.

RVNL, Titagarh, Jupiter Wagons: Why railway stocks are rallying todayRailway stocks: Share price of stocks from the railway sector such as IRCTC, RVNL, Titagarh, IRFC, Jupiter Wagons, witnessed a rise in early trade on Wedesday after major announcements from the government

Vedanta share price surges over 4%. Check key factors behind today's rallyVedanta share price today: The rally can be attributed to several factors, including operational enhancements, bullish market sentiment, and positive brokerage ratings.

Sai Life Sciences IPO opens: Should you apply? Check all details, latest GMPSai Life Sciences IPO: The public offering includes a fresh share issue worth Rs 950 crore, while promoters and existing shareholders will offload 3.81 crore shares amounting to Rs 2,092.62 crore.
Mobikwik IPO open for bidding: Subscribe or skip? Check latest GMPMobikwik IPO for bidding: The Mobikwik IPO aims to raise Rs 572 crore and will close for subscription on December 13, 2024.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as inflation data keeps market on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 1.44 points to 81,511.49, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 13.85 points to 24,623.90.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPVishal Mega Mart IPO: The public offering is entirely an offer for sale of 102.56 crore shares, which means the company will receive no capital from the listing and all proceeds will go to the selling shareholders.

Adani Ports shares to be in spotlight today. Here's why Adani group stocks: Shares of Adani Ports are expected to be in focus today after the firm shared a crucial announcement to the stock exchanges for one of its projects in Sri Lanka.

PAN 2.0: A step-by-step guide to applying for a reprint with QR codeIndian PAN cardholders can now reprint their PAN card with a QR code for just Rs 50 through Protean or UTIITSL portals, the process of which is simple and user-friendly.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Ports, Bajaj Auto, NTPC Green EnergySeveral stocks are likely to be in focus due to recent news and developments, such as Adani Ports, Adani Green Energy, Bajaj Auto, Star Health, Awfis Space, NTPC Green, among others.

Will use own resources: Adani Ports opts out of US funding for Colombo Port projectAdani Ports said the Colombo Port project was on track for commissioning by early next year and that it will fund the project through "internal accruals", aligning with its capital management strategy.

Haldiram's attracts bids from Alpha Wave, 2 others for 15-20% stake: ReportThe bids, which could mark one of India's largest private-equity deals, peg the company's valuation at Rs 75,000-80,000 crore ($8.8-9.4 billion).

Sanjay Malhotra's focus as RBI Governor: 3 key areas to watch out forBrokerage firm Nomura anticipates Sanjay Malhotra's tenure as RBI Governor may bring rate cuts, foster credit growth, and allow flexible currency management amid economic challenges.
PAN Card for minors: Benefits, documents and application process Securing a PAN card for your child ensures smooth financial transactions and better preparation for future responsibilities.
Sensex, Nifty close flat; IT leads way, rupee hits record lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 1.59 points to end at 81,510.05, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 8.95 points to close at 24,610.05.

FMCG sector slowdown: Can consumer stocks stage a comeback? After a promising run earlier this year, the FMCG sector seems to be stuck in a rough patch, as its stocks have not been performing well and has left investors wondering.

November blues for mutual funds as equity inflows down 14%: AMFI data Investment through systematic investment plans (SIPs) remained steady in November. Total SIP inflows stood at Rs 25,319.66 crore, showing little change from October's Rs 25,323 crore.

Who is Sanjay Malhotra? 5 things to know about the new RBI GovernorAs Shaktikanta Das bids farewell, Sanjay Malhotra takes charge as the 26th RBI Governor on December 11, bringing decades of experience to the role.

One RBI Governor to another: What Shaktikanta Das had to say on Sanjay MalhotraShaktikanta Das spoke highly of Sanjay Malhotra, who is set to take over as the new RBI Governor for a three-year term, effective Wednesday, December 11.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi gives rose, Tricolour to Rajnath Singh during Parliament protestIn a unique gesture of protest, Congress MP and Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, handed a rose and a Tricolour to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at the Parliament premises.

PM's adviser clarifies funding from George Soros charge: No money came directlyShamika Ravi has shot back at Congress leader Pawan Khera after he claimed that she had received funds from an organisation funded by American investor George Soros.

'Welcome' actor called for award show in UP, kidnapped, then tortured for 12 hoursAfter comedian Sunil Pal, actor Mushtaq Khan claims that he was kidnapped on the pretext of being invited to an event. A police complaint regarding the same has been filed.

Arvind Kejriwal says 'no possibility of alliance' with Congress for Delhi pollsAAP chief Arvind Kejriwal categorically ruled out any possibility of an alliance with the Congress for the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, reaffirming that his party will contest the polls "on its own strength".

Sequel culture in Indian films: Risk worth taking or milked for craze?The rise of sequels in Indian cinema, particularly pan-India projects, mirrors global trends by blending commercial appeal with expansive narratives. However, these films are increasingly criticised for their template-driven, formulaic structure, which risks overshadowing originality and innovation.
Supreme Court relaxes Manish Sisodia's bail conditions in liquor policy caseSupreme Court relief to Manish Sisodia in liquor policy case, need not appear before probe agencies every week

Mukherjee Nagar: Is Delhi's UPSC capital dying? | India Today Culture ProjectOnce the beating heart of UPSC dreams, Mukherjee Nagar was more than a locality — it was a way of life for aspirants chasing India's toughest exam.

Kareena Kapoor gets PM Modi's autograph for her sons as she meets him with familyThe Kapoor family met PM Modi to invite him to the RK Film Festival on December 14, commemorating Raj Kapoor's 100th birth anniversary. Kareena even got an autograph for her sons.

Cruelty law being misused for personal vendetta against husband: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court made the observation while setting aside a cruelty case lodged by a woman against her husband and his family which the Telangana High Court had refused to dismiss earlier.

Law Ministry's post on family courts amid outrage over techie's death by suicideAtul Subhash Suicide: The Ministry of Law and Justice issued a statement about family courts handling cases with "care and sensitivity" amid public outrage following the suicide of Bengaluru-based techie Atul Subhash.

Why McDonald's worker who helped catch CEO's killer is facing online hateLuigi Mangione's arrest for allegedly murdering UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson sparked backlash, with a McDonald's employee who tipped off police facing online trolling.

Yashraj Mukhate turns Keerthy Suresh's dosa remark into epic song video. Actor reactsThe idea behind Yashraj Mukhate's song stemmed from one of Keerthy Suresh's interviews during which she was asked about her food choices. To most of the questions, Keerthy's response was the same: Dosa.

'Human error', 'lack of proper training' led to Mumbai bus tragedy: ReportMumbai Bus Accident: A report by Regional Transport Office (RTO) officials, who conducted a probe after the accident, found that the brakes of the bus were operating well and suspect that a "human error" and "lack of proper training" led to the horrific tragedy.

In U-turn, Bangladesh confirms 88 attacks on minorities after India censureIn a big acknowledgement, Bangladesh has now officially accepted that as many as 88 incidents of communal violence against minorities, primarily Hindus, have happened following the ouster of Sheikh Hasina government in August.

Watch: Actor Manoj Manchu stopped at gate, father Mohan Babu attacks journalistOn December 10, actor Manoj Manchu was stopped at the gate of his father Mohan Babu's Japally home in Hyderabad. Mohan Babu and Manoj's fight over family and property dispute turned ugly as the veteran actor attacked a journalist.

Shah Rukh Khan visits Vikas Khanna's restaurant, chef recalls holding back tearsShah Rukh Khan recently visited Chef Vikas Khanna's new restaurant, Bungalow, in New York. The chef shared a picture and opened up about his interaction with SRK in an emotional Instagram post.

Minorities, Sheikh Hasina...: Takeaways from Indian foreign secy's Dhaka visitBoth India and Bangladesh have acknowledged the need to work closely to dispel the 'clouds' lately shrouding the bilateral relationship

Trump promises 'fully expedited' permits for anyone investing $1 billion in USIn a post on his Truth Social app on Tuesday, the President-elect said that anyone making a $1 billion investment in the US "will receive fully expedited approvals and permits, including, but in no way limited to, all environmental approvals".

Bengaluru techie suicide: A reality check of family court systemAtul Subhash Suicide Case: The over 20-page suicide note by Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash raised serious allegations against his wife, his family and even the family court system for pushing him towards the decision to end his life.

Mahira Khan responds to trolls criticising her for using SRK's name for publicityMahira Khan has responded to online trolls who criticised her for mentioning Shah Rukh Khan for 'publicity'. The actor expressed frustration and asked them to avoid asking about him if they have problems with it.

INDIA bloc to move Supreme Court against 'EVM tampering' in MaharashtraThe INDIA bloc's decision to approach the Supreme Court against the Election Commission was announced by Prashant Jagtap, leader of Sharad Pawar's NCP faction, who contested and lost the Assembly elections from the Hadapsar seat in Pune.

Delhi wakes up to coldest morning of season, temperature dips to 4.9 degreesEarlier this week, the Met Department had predicted a sharp dip in temperature in the national capital due to a cold wave which is also expected to affect the states of Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh.

Bengaluru techie's father on his suicide: He was frustrated, never showed it to usBengaluru Techie Suicide: The father of the Bengaluru techie who died by suicide said his son told him that the family court in Jaunpur did not work as per law.

Varun Dhawan's Baby John: What to expect from the remake of Atlee's TheriBollywood star Varun Dhawan takes on a thrilling new role in Baby John, a remake of the Tamil hit, Theri. Directed by Kalees and produced by Atlee, the film promises action, drama, and emotional depth.

Bigg Boss 18 Day 64: Avinash Mishra, Rajat Dalal clash over Time God titleIn the recent Bigg Boss 18 episode, contestants competed for the Time God title, leading to a clash between Rajat Dalal and Avinash Mishra over BB cash.

Zaheer Iqbal celebrates birthday with Sonakshi, Shatrughan Sinha, RekhaZaheer Iqbal celebrated his 36th birthday with an intimate gathering hosted by his actor-wife Sonakshi Sinha on December 10. An insid video from the celebration has gone viral.

sports.headline: Watch: Team India players arrive in Brisbane ahead of third Test at GabbaBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Indian cricket team players landed in Brisbane on Wednesday morning ahead of the third Test, starting December 14 at the Gabba. Batting star Shubman Gill posed for a selfie with a fan.

India tour of England 2025: Ticket craze for Edgbaston Test sets new recordIndia tour of England 2025: In a first for a non-Ashes Test in England, the tickets for the first four days of the Edgbaston Test in Birmingham have been sold out. India will play a five-match series in the Old Blightly from June 20 to August 4.

Got worried for Mohammed Siraj after Travis Head send-off: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting claimed that he got worried for Mohammed Siraj after his Travis Head send-off during the Adelaide Test. Siraj and Head got into a fiery exchange after the Indian pacer had dismissed the Aussie batter on Day 2.

Virat Kohli-Anuskha Sharma's 7th wedding anniversary: RCB, fans send in wishesRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and fans joined in to wish Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma on their 7th wedding anniversary. Kohli and Anushka got married in 2017.

Rohit Sharma should sacrifice his position for India's future: PujaraIND vs AUS, 3rd Test: Rohit Sharma should continue to bat in the middle-order feels Cheteshwar Pujara. Pujara wants KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal to continue in the top order keeping India's future in mind.

Kylian Mbappe injured? Ancelotti hopes no serious issue with Real Madrid starReal Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti is hoping that Kylian Mbappe's injury he sustained in the UEFA Champions League clash against Atalanta on Tuesday, December 10. Mbappe was in fine form during the match before the injury forced him off the field.

Lee said that Hazlewood should come in place of Scott Boland, despite the pacer's brilliant performance in the Adelaide Test win.

Jayden Seales, Brandon King help Windies clinch series with clinical winWI vs BAN: Hosts West Indies beat Bangladesh in the second ODI of the series to take an unassailable lead of 2-0. Jayden Seales won the player of the match award with a sensational four-wicket haul.

SA vs PAK: Linde, Miller star as South Africa down Pakistan in 1st T20IGeorge Linde's all-round brilliance and David Miller's explosive batting helped an inexperienced South African side down Pakistan in the first T20I of the series on Tuesday, December 10. Linde picked up 4 wickets and scored 48 runs to help his side win in Durban.

Juventus must be in top form to pose Manchester City problems: Thiago MottaJuventus manager Thiago Motta acknowledged the challenge posed by Manchester City in a high-stakes clash between two European powerhouses striving to reignite their Champions League campaigns.

Napoli's Kvaratskhelia ruled out till January after suffering knee injuryNapoli have confirmed that Khvicha Kvaratskhelia will miss action until January 2025 due to a knee ligament tear, leaving Antonio Conte's team without their star winger during crucial Serie A fixtures in an intense title race.

SA vs PAK: Miller puts on a fiery batting show vs Pakistan with his 82 off 40David Miller showcased a stunning display of power-hitting, rescuing South Africa with his 82 off 40 balls in their T20I series opener against Pakistan in Durban, turning the game around after an early top-order collapse.

Litton Das to lead Bangladesh in T20I series against West Indies Litton Das will lead a 15-man Bangladesh squad in the three-match T20I series against West Indies, starting December 15. Litton was named Bangladesh captain in the absence of regular skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto.

Laura Wolvaardt reclaims top spot in ICC Women's ODI RankingsSouth Africa's Laura Wolvaardt replaced England's Nat Sciver-Brunt as the No.1 ODI batter in the world in this week's ICC Women's ODI Player Rankings. The England all-rounder has slipped to third place with 732 points.

Imane Khelif most searched athlete on Google in 2024, Hardik in top 10Google's list of most-searched athletes in 2024 featured diverse icons, from Algerian boxing gold medallist Imane Khelif to breakout cricket star Shashank Singh.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
